results.title: Islands under the wind: Tahiti
results.creator_credit: Henry Strauss, Henry Strauss Productions and Pan American World Airways
results.brief_description: The leisurely life of the people of Tahiti and in particular the township of Papeete is depicted. Marketing, boating, fishing, dancing and going to church make up the lives of a people who work to live rather than live to work. The beautiful scenery of a typical tropical island forms a background to the dances and music of the islanders. Although, also showing the coconut industry, spear fishing and diving for pearl shell, the film primarily emphasises the scenic attractions and the easy life on the island. Narrated by Claude Dauphin.

results.title: Island of turtles
results.creator_credit: Noel Monkman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Turtles are found in the seas around the islands of the Great Barrier Reef, Queensland. Living most of its life in water the female turtle comes to land to lay her eggs in the sandy shores. After 9-10 weeks the eggs hatch out and the young turtles make their way to the sea. Also shows crested terns and other sea birds on the islands. Additional photography by C.P. Mountford.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Monkman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Island of silence
results.brief_description: Due to raids and clan wars on Easter Island in the 18th and 19th centuries, the men descending from earlier generations died out. Huge sculptures whose origin and meaning are a mystery remain from an earlier strange civilization. Juxtaposes scenes of present day craftsmen and other islanders with the heroic vision depicted in the sculptures.

results.title: Island link
results.brief_description: In March of 1957, the cable linking Tasmania with the mainland was broken. This film shows the operations necessary to locate the break and raise, repair and re-lay the submarine cable in Bass Strait.

results.title: Island fuse
results.brief_description: An experimental film in which the filmmakers are concerned with the experience of filming: the interaction between projected image, screen, camera, projector, light and filters. Old b&w documentary footage was reworked in colour, by refilming from a rear projector screen.

results.title: Island exile
results.brief_description: When a Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to the United Nations High Commission for Refugees the money was used to rehabilitate refugees in Greece, many of whom were skilled workers living a life of inactivity, misery and despair. With the arrival of a UN social worker, life for the refugees took on a new meaning. But, in many countries, the struggle for better conditions still goes on.

results.title: Island at the edge
results.creator_credit: Michael Gottlieb, Ron Blau and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: A documentary of the annual slaughter of dolphins which takes place on Iki Island, Japan, by fishermen who are trying to protect their livelihood.

results.title: Island
results.brief_description: An early Paul Cox experimental short film, this work strives to be a film poem. This talented and now renowned Australian filmmaker has presented impressions of a Greek island at war.

results.title: Islam: the prophet and the people
results.brief_description: Traces the history and growth of the Islamic faith in the Middle East and describes the basic beliefs of Muslims today. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Isabella and the magic brush (K)
results.brief_description: An animated fantasy, adapted from a Chinese fairytale, about a young girl whose desire to be an artist is thwarted by poverty, a tyrant king, and her parents, until she receives a magic brush. Animated by Barbara Dourmashkin, narrated by Alice Playton. Suitable for primary school level.
